Multi-layer approach implies - Base sys easier to secure - Dapps & side chains on # bitcoin are more complex, technically & economically
# bitcoin takes a cautious, stepped approach to DAOs etc.: Forcing that complexity to Layer 2+, keeping the base system simple.
# ethereum delivers a -lot- more to developers in one package, versus # bitcoin. Double-edged sword. More powerful + more diff to secure.
# ethereum has hugely advanced the conversation on smart contracts and self-executing programs. Very positive for ecosystem.
Possible # ethereum real use cases: - Securing secondary digital assets / side chains - DAOs - Gambling
# bitcoin has a few proven apps: non-correl. asset class, [border-] free[dom] money, dark web. # ethereum still searching for its killer app.
# ethereum is still in its economy-bootstrapping phase. # bitcoin matured beyond that; bootstrap was a success; unquestionably self-sustaining
Both # bitcoin and # ethereum should still be considered early stage, very-low-liquidity experiments with notable risks; "startup networks"
Based on degree of problem difficulty, # bitcoin, being less complex & more focused, has a better shot at succeeding long term than # ethereum
